title: (Alteration of Name of Department and Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No.
heading: 1. These Rules may be cited as the Merchant Shipping (Passenger Ships)
text_raw:
1. These Rules may be cited as the Merchant Shipping (Passenger Ships) 

(Amendment) Rules 2024.
text_norm: 1 rule may cited merchant shipping (passenger ships) (amendment) rule 2024

title: (Alteration of Name of Department and Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No.
heading: 2. Rule 20 of the Merchant Shipping (Passenger Ships) Rules 2020 (S.I.
text_raw:
2. Rule 20 of the Merchant Shipping (Passenger Ships) Rules 2020 (S.I. 

No. 640 of 2020) is amended by substituting for paragraph (2) the following: 

“(2) (a) A double bottom shall be fitted extending from the forepeak 
bulkhead to the afterpeak bulkhead as far as this is practicable 
and compatible with the design and proper working of the ship. 

(b) Where the Minister is satisfied that the fitting of a double 
bottom in accordance with subparagraph (a) is not practicable 
and compatible with the design and proper working of a ship, a 
double bottom shall be fitted at least from the machinery space 
to the forepeak bulkhead, or as near thereto as practicable.”. 

GIVEN under my hand, 
 28 May 2024 

JACK CHAMBERS, 
 Minister of State at the Department of Transport 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 31st May, 2024. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [250] 3

title: (Alteration of Name of Department and Title of Minister) Order 2020 (S.I. No.
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Rules amend Rule 20(2) of the Merchant Shipping (Passenger Ships) 
Rules 2020 (S.I. No. 640 of 2020) in relation to double bottom requirements. 

 
 
 
 
 
 4 [250]
